title: iOS Handheld
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on At Bat
and accesses the questions interface of Ask At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is on a iOS device of iOS 9.x or below
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is taken to the text entry interface immediately after going through the onboarding screen.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is on a iOS device of iOS 9.x or below
AND attempts to tap on the microphone icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is shown a message indicating that voice queries are only supported in iOS 10 or higher, but that the user is still able to ask questions using their keyboard

iOS 9 Message
Asking questions by voice requires Speech Recognition access, which is only available in iOS 10 or higher. Please upgrade your iOS version or enter questions using your keyboard.
[BUTTON]Got it[/BUTTON]

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is on a iOS device of iOS 9.x or below, taps on the microphone icon, gets a message that it is not supported,
AND the user clicks that they understand
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is taken back to the text entry interface

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is on a iOS device of iOS 10.x or above
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is able to access Ask At Bat questions interface
AND have access to the microphone & speech recognition

title: Android Handheld
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on At Bat
and accesses the questions interface of Ask At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is on an Android device of OS 5.x or below
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user isn't prompted for mic access.  The user is taken straight to the mic interface and the mic automatically begins recording. Users should be able to access both question interfaces.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is on an Android device of OS 6.x or above
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is able to access Ask At Bat questions interface
AND have access to the microphone

title: iPad
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on At Bat
custom_steps: WHEN the user accesses the questions feature Ask At Bat from an iPad
custom_expected: THEN the question bot interface should appear with full screen version currently in place is acceptable for the initial feature launch

custom_steps_separated.content:
For future release:

WHEN the user accesses the questions feature from an iPad
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the question bot interface should appear within a modal window, operating similarly to the EPG

title: Android Tablet
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on At Bat
custom_steps: WHEN the user accesses the questions feature Ask At Bat from an Android Tablet
custom_expected: THEN the tablet will not be supported in Phase 1

title: Team Update, Valid BamBot command
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in At Bat app
AND is in the questions interface of Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user makes a valid team intent: i.e.

- TEAM
- How is (the) TEAM doing?
- What is up with (the) TEAM?
- How did (the) TEAM do?

include the ones below??????????
ex:
- TEAM game
- Did the TEAM win?
- TEAM A  TEAM B game
- How did the TEAM do?
- How are the TEAM doing?
- TEAM score
- What is the score of the TEAM game?
- Are the TEAM winning?
- Are the TEAM losing?
custom_expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link for the requested team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the requested team

title: Team Update, User Follows Up for Valid BamBot Response
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in At Bat app
AND is in the questions interface of Ask At Bat
AND the user makes a valid request

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the Bot provides a valid in-season or off-season response
AND the user wanted a specific item within the stack
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link for the requested team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the requested team
AND the user is able to ask for that info as a follow-up question

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the Bot provides a valid in-season or off-season response
AND the user wanted a specific game, news event, or video
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link for the requested team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the requested team
AND the user is able to ask for that info as a follow-up question

title: Team Update, Team Name misinterpreted
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in At Bat app
AND is in the questions interface of Ask At Bat
AND the user makes a valid request

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user makes a team update request
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the team name should not be misinterpreted by the bot and should respond with the correct team info
AND the bot returns a team page deep link for the requested team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the requested team

i.e. User requests "Red Sox" so Bot should respond with "Red Sox" response, not "White Sox" response

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user makes a team update request with phatic info (in this instance phatic means anything unrelated to baseball)
AND the team name is misinterpreted by the bot

i.e. Tiggers (instead of Tigers)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN if product decides to treat "Tiggers" as "phatic"* speech, then the bot is expected to respond to "Tiggers" by saying "Bouncing is what they do best", or "huh?"

However, our bot will likely spell-check Tiggers -> Tigers, and treat it as a request for the Tigers team
AND the bot returns a team page deep link for the requested team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the requested team

title: Game Info by Day of the Week, Preview or Future Game
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in At Bat app
AND is in the questions interface of Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user makes an valid intent for a team's future game based on the day of week
AND there is an available game in the future

i.e.
Where MODIFIER is next, etc.

- TEAM (MODIFIER) DAYOFWEEK
- TEAM game ( on ) (MODIFIER) DAYOFWEEK
- When is the TEAM game ( on ) (MODIFIER) DAYOFWEEK?
- When do the TEAM play ( on ) (MODIFIER) DAYOFWEEK?
- When does the TEAM game ( on ) (MODIFIER) DAYOFWEEK?
- When do they play ( on ) (MODIFIER) DAYOFWEEK?
- When is the game ( on ) (MODIFIER) DAYOFWEEK?
- When does (MODIFIER) DAYOFWEEK 's game start?
- When does (MODIFIER) DAYOFWEEK 's game begin?
- When is (MODIFIER) DAYOFWEEK 's game?
- What time do they play ( on ) (MODIFIER) DAYOFWEEK?
- What time is the game ( on ) (MODIFIER) DAYOFWEEK?
- What time does (MODIFIER) DAYOFWEEK 's game start?
- What time does (MODIFIER) DAYOFWEEK 's game begin?
- What time is (MODIFIER) DAYOFWEEK 's game?
custom_expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link for the requested team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the requested team

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user make a requests using a day of the week in the future
AND the game is in preview

1. monday, mon
2. tuesday, tues, tue
3. wednesday, weds, wed
4. thursday, thurs, thus, thu
5. friday, fri
6. saturday, sat
7. sunday, sun

AND the user is taken to the requested Team page in At Bat

- today

custom_steps_separated.content:

custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link

custom_steps_separated.content:

custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link
AND the user is taken to the requested Team page in At Bat

AND the user is taken to the requested Team page in At Bat

AND the game is in preview:

- do / will / etc.
- Any future tense value
custom_steps_separated.expected:

AND the user is taken to the requested Team page in At Bat

AND the game is in preview

AND the user is taken to the requested Team page in At Bat

title: Team Context Retention
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in At Bat app
AND is in the questions interface of Ask At Bat
custom_expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link for the requested team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the requested team

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user makes a request about a team
AND the bot responds
AND the user makes subsequent requests
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot will assume subsequent requests in that conversation refer to that team
AND the bot returns a team page deep link
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the requested team)
AND the session will time out after 20 minutes????

i.e.
User: Did the Mets win?
Bot: deeplink
User: When is their next game?
Bot: deeplink
User: score
Bot: deeplink

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user makes a request about a team
AND the bot responds
AND the user makes subsequent request regarding another team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot will assume subsequent requests in that conversation refer to that team
AND the bot returns a team page deep link for the requested team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the requested team, until a new team is invoked
AND the session will time out after 20 minutes????

i.e. 
User: Did the Mets win?
Bot: deeplink
User: When is their next game?
Bot: deeplink
User: score
Bot: deeplink
User: What's the Braves score?
Bot: deeplink

title: Team Context Rention, based on who won or lost
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in At Bat app
AND is in the questions interface of Ask At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user makes a request game info for a past game
AND asks a follow up question asking who won

i.e. 
User: What was Orioles scores on June 22nd?
Bot: deeplink
User: Who won?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link
AND the user is taken to the requested Team page in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user makes a request game info for a past game
AND asks a follow up question asking who lost

i.e. 
User: What was Orioles scores on June 22nd?
Bot: deeplink 
User: Who lost?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link
AND the user is taken to the requested Team page in At Bat

title: Iterate Through Schedule
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in At Bat app
AND is in the questions interface of Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user who is already talking about a game / date with the bot asks about other games in proximity to the original game on the schedule:
- Conversation must have a specific team and game context
- Bot must infer a "previous" or "next" context from the user utterance
custom_expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link for the requested team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the requested team

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user requests:
- (the) next (game)
- how about (the) next (game)
- what about (the) next (game)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot return a team page deep link
AND the user is taken to the requested Team page in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user requests:
- (the) previous (game)
- how about (the) previous (game)
- what about (the) previous (game)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot return a team page deep link
AND the user is taken to the requested Team page in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user responds / follows up with a request
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot return a team page deep link
AND the user is taken to the requested Team page in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user requests a given date

i.e.

<it's Thursday>
User: Previous 
Bot: deeplink
User: Next
Bot: deeplink 
User: Next
Bot: deeplink 
User: Previous 
Bot: deeplink 
User: next game after Friday
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot return a team page deep link
AND the user is taken to the requested Team page in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks for games by day of the following week (Friday June 30; Friday July 7)

i.e.
User: Yankees game Friday
Bot: deeplink
User: Yankees game next Friday
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot return a team page deep link
AND the user is taken to the requested Team page in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks for games by day of the following week and the week after (Friday June 30; Friday July 7; Friday July 14 etc.)

i.e.
User: Yankees game Friday
Bot: deeplink
User: Yankees game next Friday
Bot: deeplink
User: Yankees game next Friday after that
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot return a team page deep link
AND the user is taken to the requested Team page in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN there are no previous or next games
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot return a team page deep link
AND the user is taken to the requested Team page in At Bat

title: Get Missing Team Context
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in At Bat app
AND is in the questions interface of Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
When the user provides an invalid intent with missing or non-mathcing team or team local
And the bot does not recognize the intent

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user keeps providing an invalid intent that bot still does not recognize
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the bot's response is:
1. Which $CITYNAME team?
2. Sorry, which $CITYNAME team did you want?
3. Which team in $CITYNAME?

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user provides an invalid intent 3x in a row
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the bot drops the conversational context; such that on a user's next utterance / request, the Bot ignores the user's previous query

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user provides a valid intent with valid team or team local
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link for the requested team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the requested team

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user does not respond
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the bot will not do anything

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user switches to another valid intent
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link for the requested team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the requested team

title: Requests phrased different provides same response
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in At Bat app
AND is in the questions interface of Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
When the user makes the same intent phrased differently

i.e.
Request 1: "what was last Friday's nats score?"
Request 2: "what was the nats score last Friday?"
custom_expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link for the requested team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the requested team

title: Team vs. Team
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in At Bat app
AND is in the questions interface of Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user requests to get information about the next time a team plays an opponent.

i.e.

- yankees mariners
- yankees mariners series
- when do the yankees and mariners play?
- when is the yankees mariners?
- when is the next yankees mariners series?
- when do the yankees and mariners play next?
- when did the yankees and mariners last play?
custom_expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link for the first team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the first requested team

custom_steps_separated.content: When the two teams requested have not yet played during the regular season
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link for the first team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the first requested team

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the request is for a future matchup of two teams that don't play again during the regular season
AND there is No Tie.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link for the first team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the first requested team

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the request is for a future matchup of two teams that don't play again during the regular season
AND there is a Tie.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link for the first team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the first requested team

http://m.mlb.com/atbat/postseason/history/[YEAR]/world-series/

i.e. http://m.mlb.com/atbat/postseason/history/2011/world-series/

custom_steps_separated.expected:

http://m.mlb.com/atbat/postseason/history/[LastYear]/world-series/

i.e. http://m.mlb.com/atbat/postseason/history/2016/world-series/

AND accesses the Questions interface

AND the response does not contain a deeplink

title: Valid BamBot command, intent not recognized
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in At Bat app
AND is in the questions interface of Ask At Bat
custom_steps: WHEN the user makes an valid team intent but the intent is not recognized
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:
I don't recognize that request. Try asking about a team.

title: Invalid BamBot command, intent not recognized
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in At Bat app
AND is in the questions interface of Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user makes an invalid intent
i.e.
- yo
- lol
- hey
- wat
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with any of the following:
- I didn't quite get that. Try again?
- Not sure I follow. Type that again?
- Sorry, I didn't get that. Try asking me about an MLB team.
- I'm not sure what you wanted there.
AND the user is able to make another intent

title: EDIT_Invalid BamBot command, intent not recognized, user makes another intent
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in At Bat app
AND is in the questions interface of Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user makes an invalid utterance (i.e. yo, lol, hey, wat, etc.)
AND the bot will response with clever and useful repsonses, 
i.e.
"I didn't quite get that. Try again?"
"Not sure I follow. Type that again?"
"Sorry, I didn't get that. Tray asking me about an MLB team."
"I'm not sure what you wanted there."
AND the user is able to make another of the following intents
custom_expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link for the requested team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the requested team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user repeats their invalid intent
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user reply with one of the responses mentioned above in the steps

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user resorts to cursing
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user reply with one of the responses mentioned above in the steps

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user makes a valid intent
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the response will be fulfilled with a valid response

title: Multi-Team Locale
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in At Bat app
AND is in the questions interface of Ask At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user utters a locale with multiple teams
i.e.
- Chicago
- Los Angeles, LA or L.A.
- New York or NY
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot responds with either of the following:
- Which [Team_Locale] Team?
- Sorry, which [Team_Locale] Team?
- Which team in [Team_Local]?

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is able to provide a team context
i.e.
- Cubs
- Dodger
- Mets
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link for the requested team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the requested team

title: Multi-Team Locale, User Response
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in At Bat app
AND is in the questions interface of Ask At Bat
custom_steps: WHEN the user supplies a team name via either of the following methods

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is presented with a quick reply prompt
i.e.
- Chicago "Cubs" or "White Sox"
- Los Angeles "Dodgers" or "Angels"
- New York "Mets" or "Yankees"
AND the user taps on a quick reply option
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link for the requested team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the requested team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user enters or speaks valid text containing the team name in the text field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link for the requested team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the requested team

title: Multi-Team Locale Ambiguous, User Repeats Ambiguous Response
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in At Bat app
AND is in the questions interface of Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user utters an ambiguous locale with multiple teams (i.e. Chicago, Los Angeles, New York, etc.)
AND the bot responds with either of the following:
- Which [Team_Locale] Team?
- Sorry, which [Team_Locale] Team?
- Which team in [Team_Local]?
AND the user repeats the same ambiguous team name
custom_expected:
THEN the bot responds with either of the following:
- Which [Team_Locale] Team?
- Sorry, which [Team_Locale] Team?
- Which team in [Team_Local]?

title: EDIT_Multi-Team Locale Invalid, User Response
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in At Bat app
AND is in the questions interface of Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user utters an invalid locale with multiple teams (i.e. Chicago, Los Angeles, New York, etc.)
AND the bot responds with either of the following:
- Which [Team_Locale] Team?
- Sorry, which [Team_Locale] Team?
- Which team in [Team_Local]?
AND the user provides an invalid team name
custom_expected: THEN the user will get missing team context (link TBA).

title: Multi-Team Locale, No User Response
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in At Bat app
AND is in the questions interface of Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user utters an invalid locale with multiple teams (i.e. Chicago, Los Angeles, New York, etc.)
AND the bot responds with either of the following:
- Which [Team_Locale] Team?
- Sorry, which [Team_Locale] Team?
- Which team in [Team_Local]?
AND the user does not provide a response
custom_expected: THEN nothing will occur

title: EDIT_Top Videos for a Team
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in At Bat app
AND is in the questions interface of Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user makes the intent to ask for the top videos for a team
i.e.
[teamName] video
[teamName] videos
[teamName] top video
[teamName] top videos
custom_expected:
THEN the bot returns a team page deep link for the requested team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the requested team
